solution_line_template: Following her rule, Gail keeps {second_tank_gallons} / {second_tank_fish_size} = <<{second_tank_gallons}/{second_tank_fish_size}={second_tank_fish}>>{second_tank_fish} two-inch fish in the second tank.
She keeps {first_tank_gallons} / {first_tank_fish_size} = <<{first_tank_gallons}/{first_tank_fish_size}={first_tank_fish}>>{first_tank_fish} fish in the first tank.

If one fish in the first tank ate another, she would have {first_tank_fish} - {eaten_fish} = <<{first_tank_fish}-{eaten_fish}={first_tank_fish_after_eating}>>{first_tank_fish_after_eating} fish in the first tank.
Thus, Gail would have {first_tank_fish_after_eating} - {second_tank_fish} = <<{first_tank_fish_after_eating}-{second_tank_fish}={fish_difference}>>{fish_difference} more fish in the first tank.
